DOC.brief_summary: The purpose 2-year pilot study explore impact deployment psychosocial health characteristic reintegration Military Chaplains , specifically Army National Guard ( ARNG ) . This pilot serve foundation subsequent investigation chaplains multiple branch military . In addition spiritual religious support , Military Chaplains play key role behavioral health deploy service-members , routinely participate suicide prevention training , conduct critical event debriefing , identify service-members risk combat operational stress reactions1 . A high risk group exposure trauma2 , Military Chaplains suffer brain injury , gunshot wound blast injury OEF/OIF Theater3 . In addition , many report combat related stress issue compassion fatigue , PTSD , reintegration issues3 . While traumatic experience OEF/OIF deploy troop well document , effect military chaplain care service-members receive little attention research date . We collaborate National Guard Chaplain Corps Leadership program research . The aims 2-year pilot cross-sectional study focus describe explore deployment impact psychosocial , health characteristic reintegration ARNG chaplains use mixed method approach ( web-based survey , in-depth interview , social network analysis ) .
DOC.brief_title: Exploring Deployment Stress Reintegration Army National Guard Chaplains
